intro: Batidaea strigosa subsp. amplissima, commonly known as the broad-leaved batidaea, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its robust, aromatic foliage and small, white flowers that appear in umbel-like clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Its leaves are broad and pinnately divided, with a hairy texture that gives it a distinctive appearance. This subspecies is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
